briefTitle: A Mobile Personal Health Record for Behavioral Health Homes
officialTitle: A Mobile Personal Health Record for Behavioral Health Homes

protocolDocument.label: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

eligibilityCriteria.criteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* one or more of the following conditions: hyperlipidemia, hypertension, diabetes
* able to give consent
* patient in the behavioral health home

Exclusion Criteria:

* Unable to give consent

primary.description: It is a measure of quality of care. The aggregate score represents the total number of eligible services received for an individual generated by dividing all instances in which recommended care was delivered by the number of times a participant was eligible for the indicator. The score ranges from 0 to 1 with higher scores indicating receipt of recommended care/services.

secondary.measure: Change in Patient Assessment of Chronic Illness Care
secondary.description: 20-item patient self-report instrument that assesses the extent to which patients with chronic illness report receiving care that aligns with the Chronic Care Model. The summary score ranges from 1 to 5 with a higher score indicating patient's perception of greater involvement in self-management and receipt of chronic care counseling.
secondary.timeFrame: Baseline, 6 month post intervention, 12 month post intervention

secondary.description: Assesses a patients' perceived ability to manage their illnesses and their healthcare visits. Patient Activation Measure Scores were summed to calculate the overall raw score then transformed to an activation scale ranging from 0 to 100. Higher scores indicate greater patient activation.
secondary.timeFrame: Baseline, 6 month post intervention, 12 month post intervention

secondary.measure: Change in Health-related Quality of Life
secondary.description:
Measured using the Physical and Mental Component Summary scales of the SF-12. Assesses a patients' perceived health related quality of life.

The composite physical (PCS) and mental component (MCS) summary scores for the SF-12 are each scored on a 0-100 scale. Higher scores indicate better functioning.
secondary.timeFrame: Baseline, 6 month post intervention, 12 month post intervention
